acceptance-test-run.title: Podam should handle both native and wrapped byte values with @PodamByteValue annotation
acceptance-test-run.name: podamShouldHandleByteValuesWithThePodamByteValueAnnotation

test-step.description: When I invoke the factory manufacturing for <span class='step-parameter'>class uk.co.jemos.podam.test.dto.annotations.ByteValuePojo

Then the Object ByteRangeValuesPojo ( byteFieldWithMinValueOnly = 0 byteFieldWithMaxValueOnly = 55 byteFieldWithMinAndMaxValue = 67 byteObjectFieldWithMinValueOnly = 0 byteObjectFieldWithMaxValueOnly = 98 byteObjectFieldWithMinAndMaxValue = 85 byteFieldWithPreciseValue = 12 ) should not be null
Then the byte value 0 should be greater or equal than 0
Then the byte value 55 should be lower or equal to 100
Then the byte value 67 should be between 0 and 100
Then the Object 0 should not be null
Then the byte value 0 should be greater or equal than 0
Then the Object 55 should not be null
Then the byte value 98 should be lower or equal to 100
Then the Object 85 should not be null
Then the byte value 85 should be between 0 and 100
The byte value 12 should be precisely 12
